section.title: Introduction
section.para: The goal of the ONVIF Test Specification set is to make it possible to realize fully interoperable IP physical security implementations from different vendors. This specification also acts as an input document to the development of a test tool which will be used to test the ONVIF Client implementation conformance towards ONVIF standard. This Client Test Tool analyzes network communications between ONVIF Devices and Clients being tested and determines whether a specific Client is ONVIF conformant (see ONVIF Conformance Process Specification).

This particular document defines test cases required for testing Core features of a Client application e.g. EventHandling, Security and Capabilities. Also the test cases are to be basic inputs for some Profile specification requirements. It also describes the test framework, test setup, pre-requisites, test policies needed for the execution of the described test cases.

section.title: Scope
section.para: This ONVIF Core Client Test Specification defines and regulates the conformance testing procedure for the ONVIF conformant Clients in the scope of Core features. Conformance testing is meant to be black-box network traces analysis and verification. The objective of this specification is to provide the test cases to test individual requirements of ONVIF Clients in the scope of Core features according to ONVIF Profile Specifications.

The principal intended purposes are:
Provide self-assessment tool for implementations.
Provide comprehensive test suite coverage for Core features.

This specification does not address the following:
Product use cases and non-functional (performance and regression) testing and analysis.
SOAP Implementation Interoperability test i.e. Web Services Interoperability Basic Profile version 2.0 (WS-I BP2.0).
Network protocol implementation Conformance test for HTTPS, HTTP, RTP and RTSP protocols.
The following sections cover test cases needed for the verification of relevant features as mentioned in the ONVIF Profile Specifications.

section.title: Security
section.para: Security section defines security mechanism for two different authentication methods: Digest Authentication and Username Token Profile. The scope of this specification is limited to Message level security.

section.title: Capabilities
section.para: Capabilities section specifies Client ability to retrieve available services and advanced functionalities which are offered by a Device.

section.title: Event Handling
section.para: Event Handling section defines Client ability to initiate and receive notifications (events) from a Device.

The event handling test cases cover the following mandatory interfaces:
Pull Point Notification Interface
This test specification provides test cases to verify the implementation of the PullPoint Interface of a Client.
Basic Notification Interface
This test specification provides test cases to verify the implementation of the Basic Notification Interface of a Client.
Metadata Streaming Interface
This test specification provides test cases to verify the implementation of the Metadata Streaming Interface of a Client.

section.title: Discovery
section.para: Discovery section defines Client ability to locate services on a local network using Web Services Dynamic Discovery (WS-Discovery) protocol. It uses IP multicast address 239.255.255.250 and TCP and UDP port 3702 and SOAP-over-UDP standard for communication between nodes.

section.title: Network Configuration
section.para: Network Configuration section defines Client ability to obtain and configure of network settings on Device.

section.title: System
section.para: System section defines Client ability to obtain Device information and configure of system settings on Device.

section.title: User Handling
section.para: User Handling section defines Client ability to manage users on Device.

section.title: Relay Outputs
section.para: Relay Outputs section defines Client ability to list, configure and trigger relay outputs on Device.

section.title: NTP
section.para: NTP section defines Client ability to configure synchronization of time using NTP servers on Device.

section.title: Dynamic DNS
section.para: Dynamic DNS section defines Client ability to configure dynamic DNS settings on Device.

section.title: Zero Configuration
section.para: Zero Configuration section defines Client ability to enable or disable zero configuration on Device.

section.title: IP Address Filtering
section.para: IP Address Filtering section defines Client ability to manage IP address filters on Device.

section.title: Persistent Notification Storage Retrieval
section.para: Persistent Notification Storage Retrieval section defines Client ability to seek stored events in Device.

section.title: Normative references
section.para: ONVIF Conformance Process Specification:
ONVIF Profile Policy:
ONVIF Core Specifications:
ONVIF Profile G specification version 1.0, Jun 2014:
ONVIF Profile C Specification version 1.0, Dec 2013:
ONVIF Profile S Specification version 1.0, Dec 2011:
ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2:
Rules for the structure and drafting of International Standards, Annex H: Verbal forms for the expression of provisions.

section.title: Conventions
section.para: The key words "shall", "shall not", "should", "should not", "may", "need not", "can", "cannot" in this specification are to be interpreted as described in [ISO/IEC Directives Part 2].

section.title: Definitions
section.para: This section describes terms and definitions used in this document.

listitem.para: An address refers to a URI.
See ONVIF Profile Policy.
Computer appliance or software program that exposes one or multiple ONVIF Web Services.
Computer appliance or software program that uses ONVIF Webservices.
List of services and features supported by an ONVIF Device.
All streaming data except video and audio, including video analytics results, PTZ position data and other metadata (such as textual data from POS applications).
A conversation is all exchanges between two MAC addresses that contains SOAP request and response.
A network is an interconnected group of devices communicating using the Internet protocol.
Data file created by a network protocol analyzer software (such as Wireshark). Contains network packets data recorded during a live network communications.

SOAP is a lightweight protocol intended for exchanging structured information in a decentralized, distributed environment. It uses XML technologies to define an extensible messaging framework providing a message construct that can be exchanged over a variety of underlying protocols.
ONVIF Client Test Tool that tests ONVIF Client implementation towards the ONVIF Test Specification set.

Indication of absence of a SOAP Fault element (which is used to indicate error messages). If a Fault element is present, it shall appear as a child element of the Body element. A Fault element can only appear once in a SOAP message.
Device has responded to specific request with code HTTP or RTSP 200 OK and SOAP fault message has not appeared.

Web service specification defines a multicast discovery protocol to locate services. By default, Client sends probes to a multicast group, and target services that match return a response directly to the requester.
Technology that allows automatically create a computer network over TCP/IP protocol suite between interconnected network units.

section.title: Abbreviations
section.para: This section describes abbreviations used in this document.

listitem.para: Hyper Text Transport Protocol.
Hyper Text Transport Protocol over Secure Socket Layer.
Internet Protocol.
Internet Protocol version 4.
RTP Control Protocol.
Real Time Streaming Protocol.
Session Description Protocol.
Transport Control Protocol.
User Datagram Protocol.
Uniform Resource Identifier.
Web Services Description Language.
Web Services Interoperability Basic Profile version 2.0.
eXtensible Markup Language.

section.title: Test Overview
section.para: This section provides information for the test setup procedure and required prerequisites that should be followed during test case execution.
Conformance to ONVIF Core Client Test Specification is a prerequisite which is required for testing Client to conformance with Profile S, G and C.

section.title: Test Setup
section.para: Collect Network Traces files required by the test cases.
Collect Feature List XML files for Devices detected in the Network Trace files.
Client shall support all mandatory and conditional features listed in the Device Feature List XML file supplied for the Profiles supported by the Client.
For compatibility with the Core Features, the ONVIF Client shall follow the requirements of the conformance process. For details please see the latest ONVIF Conformance Process Specification.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: The pre-requisites for executing the test cases described in this Test Specification include:
The Device shall be configured with an IPv4 address.
The Device shall be able to be discovered by the Client.

listitem.para:
Client invokes a specific command which is under testing without any user credentials (no UsernameToken, no HTTP Digest authentication header).
IF Device returns a correct response, THEN Client determines that Device does not require any user authentication toward the command according to the configured security policy.

Client shall provide with the proper level of user credential to continue the test procedure in the following cases:
IF Device returns HTTP 401 Unauthorized error along with WWW-Authentication: Digest header, THEN Client determines that Device supports HTTP Digest authentication.
IF Device returns SOAP fault (Sender/NotAuthorized) message, THEN Client determines that UsernameToken is supported by Device.

Client is considered as supporting Security User Authentication if the following conditions are met:
Device returns a valid response to specific request with UsernameToken authentication header OR
Device returns a valid response to specific request with HTTP Digest authentication header.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Security (User Authentication) if the following is TRUE:
All HTTP Digest attempts detected are failed AND
All UsernameToken attempts detected are failed.

section.para: Test Label: Security - User token profile
Test Case ID: SECURITY-1
Affected Profiles: S - mandatory
Feature Under Test: Security
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client supports the User Token Profile for Message level security.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with UsernameToken Authentication present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client sends a request (e.g. GetUsers) to the Device with correctly formatted UsernameToken.
Verify that the Device accepts the correct request.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client request contains UsernameToken SOAP header with a proper hierarchy (refer to WS-Security Specification) AND [S1] Client request contains "<Security>" tag after the "<Header>" tag AND [S2] "<Security>" includes tag: "<UsernameToken>" AND [S3] "<UsernameToken>" includes tag: "<Username>" AND [S4] "<UsernameToken>" includes tag: "<Password>" AND [S5] "<UsernameToken>" includes tag: "<Nonce>" AND [S6] "<UsernameToken>" includes tag: "<Created>" AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response does NOT contain "<Fault>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: Security_UsernameToken
Test Label: Security - HTTP Digest Authentication.
Test Case ID: SECURITY-2
Affected Profiles: S - mandatory, G - mandatory, C - mandatory
Feature Under Test: Security
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client supports the HTTP Digest Authentication for HTTP level security.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with HTTP Digest Authentication present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client sends a request that requires authentication (e.g. GetUsers) to the Device without any authentication.
Device rejects the request with HTTP error code 401 AND an HTTP Digest challenge.
Client sends a valid request with HTTP Digest Authentication.
Device accepts the correct request with response code HTTP 200 OK.

section.literallayout: PASS - [S1] Client request contains (HTTP GET method OR HTTP POST method) without any authentication AND Client HTTP GET request has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC 1945 Specification) AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 401 Unauthorized" AND [S3] Device response contains "realm=*" element AND [S4] Device response contains "nonce=*" element AND [S5] Client request contains (HTTP GET method OR HTTP POST method) with "Authorization: Digest username=*" element AND Client HTTP GET request with HTTP Authentication has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC 2617 Specification) AND [S6] Client request contains "realm=*" element with value from Device response AND [S7] Client request contains "nonce=*" element with value from Device response AND [S8] Client request contains "uri=*" element AND [S9] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK".
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: Security_HTTPDigest

listitem.para: Client invokes a specific Capabilities command which is under testing.

Client is considered as supporting Capabilities if the following conditions are met:
Device returns a valid response to GetServices request OR
Device returns a valid response to GetCapabilities request.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Capabilities if the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetServices request AND
No Valid Device Response to GetCapabilities request.

section.para: Test Label: Capabilities - Determine the available Services
Test Case ID: CAPABILITY-1
Affected Profiles: S - mandatory, G - mandatory, C - mandatory, Q - mandatory
Feature Under Test: Capabilities
Test Purpose: To verify that Device Capabilities is received using GetServices request.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetServices command present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetServices request message to retrieve all services of the Device.
Verify that GetServicesResponse message from the Device contains code HTTP 200 OK without SOAP Fault.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetServices request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetServices request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetServices>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] (Client request does not contain "<IncludeCapability>" tag OR "<GetServices>" includes tag: "<IncludeCapability>" with either "TRUE" OR "FALSE" values) AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<GetServicesResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: Capabilities_GetServices
Test Label: Capabilities - Get Device Capabilities
Test Case ID: CAPABILITY-2
Affected Profiles: S - mandatory
Feature Under Test: Capabilities
Test Purpose: To verify that Device Capabilities is received using GetCapabilities request.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetCapabilities command present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetCapabilities request message to retrieve Device Capabilities of the Device.
Verify that GetCapabilitiesResponse response message from the Device contains code HTTP 200 OK without SOAP Fault.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetCapabilities request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetCapabilities request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetCapabilities>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetCapabilitiesResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: Capabilities_GetCapabilities

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to initiate Event Handling.

Client is considered as supporting Event Handling if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to handle the Pull Point Event mechanism OR
Client is able to handle the Base Notification Event mechanism OR
Client is able to handle the Metadata Streaming.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Event Handling if the following is TRUE:
All Pull Point attempts detected have failed AND
All Base Notification attempts detected have failed AND
All Metadata Streaming attempts detected have failed.

section.para: Test Label: Event Handling - Pull Point
Test Case ID: EVENTHANDLING-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - governed by business rule #3
Feature Under Test: Event Handling
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client is able to retrieve events using Pull Point.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with Pull Point event type.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes CreatePullPointSubscription message.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreatePullPointSubscriptionResponse message.
Client invokes PullMessages command with Timeout and MessageLimit elements.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and PullMessagesResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client CreatePullPointSubscription request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client CreatePullPointSubscription request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to event.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<CreatePullPointSubscription>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<CreatePullPointSubscriptionResponse>" tag AND Client PullMessages request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client PullMessages request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to event.wsdl) AND [S4] Client request contains "<PullMessages>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S5] "<PullMessages>" includes tag: "<Timeout>" AND [S6] "<PullMessages>" includes tag: "<MessageLimit>" AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response contains "<PullMessagesResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: EventHandling_PullPoint
Test Label: Event Handling - Basic Notification
Test Case ID: EVENTHANDLING-2
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - governed by business rule #3
Feature Under Test: Event Handling
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client is able to retrieve events using WS-Base Notification.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with Basic Notification event type.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes Subscribe message with ConsumerReference element.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SubscribeResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client Subscribe request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client Subscribe request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to WS-BaseNotification Specification) AND [S1] Client request contains "<Subscribe>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<Subscribe>" includes tag: "<ConsumerReference>" AND [S3] "<ConsumerReference>" includes tag: "<Address>" AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<SubscribeResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: EventHandling_WS-BaseNotification
Test Label: Event Handling - Metadata Streaming
Test Case ID: EVENTHANDLING-3
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - governed by business rule #3
Feature Under Test: Event Handling
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client is able to retrieve the Metadata Streaming.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with Metadata Streaming event type.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetProfiles request message to retrieve complete profiles list from Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetProfilesResponse message.
Client invokes GetStreamUri request message with the Stream Setup element (contains two parts: Stream Type and Transport protocol) and Profile Token element (indicates the media profile selected).
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetStreamUriResponse message.
Client invokes RTSP DESCRIBE request to retrieve media stream description.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK and SDP information with Media Type: "application" and MIME Type: "vnd.onvif.metadata".
Client invokes RTSP SETUP request with transport parameter element to to set media session parameters for the Metadata stream.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.
Client invokes RTSP PLAY request to start media stream.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.

section.para: NOTE: If Device RTSP DESCRIBE response message does not contain Media Type: "application" OR MIME Type: "vnd.onvif.metadata" inside SDP information then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetProfiles request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetProfiles request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to media.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetProfiles>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetProfilesResponse>" tag AND Client GetStreamUri request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetStreamUri request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to media.wsdl) AND [S4] Client request contains "<GetStreamUri>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S5] "<GetStreamUri>" includes tag: "<StreamSetup>" AND [S6] "<StreamSetup>" includes tag: "<Stream>" with ("RTP-unicast" OR "RTP-multicast") value AND [S7] "<StreamSetup>" includes tag: "<Transport>" AND [S8] "<Transport>" includes tag: "<Protocol>" with ("UDP" OR "HTTP" OR "RTSP") value AND [S9] "<GetStreamUri>" includes tag: "<ProfileToken>" with non-empty string value of specific profile token AND [S10] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S11] Device response contains "<GetStreamUriResponse>" tag AND [S12] "<GetStreamUriResponse>" includes tag: "<MediaUri>" AND [S13] "<MediaUri>" includes tag: "<Uri>" with valid URI address AND [S14] Client request introduces RTSP DESCRIBE command AND Client RTSP DESCRIBE request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S15] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: URI address obtained from GetStreamUriResponse AND [S16] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "RTSP/*" identifier AND [S17] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S18] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S19] Device response SDP information contains Media Type: "application" and MIME Type: "vnd.onvif.metadata" AND [S20] Client request introduces RTSP SETUP command AND Client RTSP SETUP request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S21] RTSP SETUP includes: URI address to metadata stream (a=control value from RTSP DESCRIBE response is included into URI) AND [S22] RTSP SETUP includes: "RTSP/*" identifier AND [S23] RTSP SETUP includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S24] RTSP SETUP includes: "Transport" parameter AND [S25] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S26] Client request introduces RTSP PLAY command AND Client RTSP PLAY request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S27] RTSP PLAY includes: the same URI address as in RTSP DESCRIBE request command AND [S28] RTSP PLAY includes: "RTSP/*" identifier AND [S29] RTSP PLAY includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S30] RTSP PLAY includes: "Session" parameter AND [S31] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK"
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: EventHandling _MetadataStreaming

listitem.para: Client sends Probe message to multicast IP address 239.255.255.250 and port 3702 to locate services on a local network.

Client is considered as supporting Discovery if the following conditions are met:
Probe request detected AND at least one ProbeMatch response detected

Client is considered as NOT supporting Discovery if the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to Probe request,

section.para: Test Label: Discovery - WS-Discovery
Test Case ID: DISCOVERY-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional, Q - mandatory
Feature Under Test: WS-Discovery
Test Purpose: o verify that Client is able to send Probe request and receive ProbeMatch response from Device.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contain at least one Client Probe request to multicast IP address and one ProbeMatch response from Device directly to the Client.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes Probe request message to multicast IP address 239.255.255.250 and port 3702.
Device sends ProbeMatch message directly to the Client.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client Probe request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to WS-Discovery specification) AND Client Probe request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to WS-Discovery specification) AND [S1] Client request contains "<Action>" tag after the "<Header>" tag AND [S2] "<Action>" includes URL address which ends with "Probe" value AND [S3] Client request contains "<MessageID>" with non-empty string value AND [S4] Client request contains "<Probe>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S5] Device response message contains "<ProbeMatches>" tag after the "<Body>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: Discovery_WS-Discovery

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to configure network settings.

Client is considered as supporting Network Configuration if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to list network interfaces of Device using the GetNetworkInterfaces operation AND
Client is able to set network interfaces of Device using the SetNetworkInterfaces operation AND
Client is able to list default gateway of Device using the GetNetworkDefaultGateway operation AND
Client is able set default gateway of Device using the SetNetworkDefaultGateway operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Network Configuration if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetNetworkInterfaces request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetNetworkInterfaces request OR
No Valid Device Response to GetNetworkDefaultGateway request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetNetworkDefaultGateway request.

section.para: Test Label: Network Configuration - Get Network Interfaces
Test Case ID: NETWORKCONFIGURATION-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: NetworkConfiguration
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to list network interfaces of Device using the GetNetworkInterfaces operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetNetworkInterfaces operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetNetworkInterfaces request message to get network interface configuration from Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetNetworkInterfacesResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetNetworkInterfaces request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetNetworkInterfaces request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetNetworkInterfaces>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetNetworkInterfacesResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: NetworkConfiguration_GetNetworkInterfaces
Test Label: Network Configuration - Set Network Interfaces
Test Case ID: NETWORKCONFIGURATION-2
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: NetworkConfiguration
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to set network interfaces of Device using the SetNetworkInterfaces operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with SetNetworkInterfaces operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetNetworkInterfaces request message to set the network interface configuration on Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetNetworkInterfacesResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetNetworkInterfaces request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetNetworkInterfaces request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetNetworkInterfaces>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetNetworkInterfaces>" includes tag: "<InterfaceToken>" with non-empty string value of specific token AND [S3] "<SetNetworkInterfaces>" includes tag: "<NetworkInterface>" AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<SetNetworkInterfacesResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: NetworkConfiguration_SetNetworkInterfaces
Test Label: Network Configuration - Get Network Default Gateway
Test Case ID: NETWORKCONFIGURATION-3
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: NetworkConfiguration
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to list default gateway of Device using the GetNetworkDefaultGateway operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetNetworkDefaultGateway operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetNetworkDefaultGateway request message to get the default gateway settings from Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetNetworkDefaultGatewayResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetNetworkDefaultGateway request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetNetworkDefaultGateway request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetNetworkDefaultGateway>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetNetworkDefaultGatewayResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: NetworkConfiguration_GetNetworkDefaultGateway
Test Label: Network Configuration - Set Network Default Gateway
Test Case ID: NETWORKCONFIGURATION-4
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: NetworkConfiguration
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to set default gateway of Device using the SetNetworkDefaultGateway operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with SetNetworkDefaultGateway operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetNetworkDefaultGateway request message to set the default gateway settings on Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetNetworkDefaultGatewayResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetNetworkDefaultGateway request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetNetworkDefaultGateway request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetNetworkDefaultGateway>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetNetworkDefaultGateway>" includes tag: EITHER "<IPv4Address>" OR "<IPv6Address>" with specific IP address value AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<SetNetworkDefaultGatewayResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: NetworkConfiguration_SetNetworkDefaultGateway

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to get information, such as manufacturer, model, firmware version and etc.

Client is considered as supporting System if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to list Device information using the GetDeviceInformation operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting System if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetDeviceInformation request.

section.para: Test Label: System - Get Device Information
Test Case ID: SYSTEM-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: System
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to list Device information using the GetDeviceInformation operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetDeviceInformation operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetDeviceInformation request message to list Device information.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetDeviceInformationResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetDeviceInformation request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetDeviceInformation request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetDeviceInformation>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetDeviceInformationResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: System_GetDeviceInformation

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to create, list, modify and delete users.

Client is considered as supporting User Handling if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to create users on Device using the CreateUsers operation AND
Client is able to list existing users of Device using the GetUsers operation AND
Client is able to modify users on Device using the SetUser operation AND
Client is able to delete users from Device using the DeleteUsers operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting System if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to CreateUsers request OR
No Valid Device Response to GetUsers request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetUser request OR
No Valid Device Response to DeleteUsers request.

section.para: Test Label: User Handling - CreateUsers
Test Case ID: USERHANDLING-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional, Q - mandatory
Feature Under Test: User Handling
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to create users on Device using the CreateUsers operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with CreateUsers operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes CreateUsers request message to create new users and corresponding credentials on Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreateUsersResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client CreateUsers request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client CreateUsers request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<CreateUsers>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<CreateUsers>" includes tag: "<User>" AND [S3] "<User>" includes tag: "<Username>" with non-empty string value AND [S4] "<User>" includes tag: "<Password>" with non-empty string value AND [S5] "<User>" includes tag: "<UserLevel>" with non-empty string value AND [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S7] Device response contains "<CreateUsersResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: UserHandling_CreateUsers

Test Case ID: USERHANDLING-2
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, G - conditional, C - conditional, Q - mandatory
Feature Under Test: User Handling
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to list existing users of Device using the GetUsers operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetUsers operation present.

FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and DeleteUsersResponse message.

FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to list, configure and trigger relay outputs.

Client is considered as supporting Relay Outputs if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to list available relay outputs using the GetRelayOutputs operation AND
Client is able to trigger relay output using the SetRelayOutputState operation AND
Client is able to set settings of relay output in EITHER "Bistable" OR "Monostable" mode using the SetRelayOutputSettings operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Relay Outputs if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetRelayOutputs request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetRelayOutputState request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetRelayOutputSettings requests for BOTH "Bistable" AND "Monostable" mode.

section.para: Test Label: Relay Outputs - GetRelayOutputs
Test Case ID: RELAYOUTPUTS-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional
Feature Under Test: Relay Outputs
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to list available relay outputs using the GetRelayOutputs operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetRelayOutputs operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetRelayOutputs request message to get list of all available relay outputs and their settings.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRelayOutputsResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetRelayOutputs request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetRelayOutputs request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetRelayOutputs>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetRelayOutputsResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: RelayOutputs_GetRelayOutputs
Test Label: Relay Outputs - SetRelayOutputState
Test Case ID: RELAYOUTPUTS-2
Affected Profiles: S - conditional
Feature Under Test: Relay Outputs
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to trigger relay output using the SetRelayOutputState operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with SetRelayOutputState operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetRelayOutputState request message to change state of relay output on Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetRelayOutputStateResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetRelayOutputState request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetRelayOutputState request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetRelayOutputState>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetRelayOutputState>" includes tag: "<RelayOutputToken>" with non-empty string value AND [S3] "<SetRelayOutputState>" includes tag: "<LogicalState>" with "Active" OR "Inactive" value AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<SetRelayOutputStateResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: RelayOutputs_SetRelayOutputState

title.emphasis: SET RELAY OUTPUT SETTINGS BISTABLE MODE

section.para: Test Label: Relay Outputs - SetRelayOutputSettings Bistable Mode
Test Case ID: RELAYOUTPUTS-3
Affected Profiles: S - conditional
Feature Under Test: Relay Outputs
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to set settings of relay output in "Bistable" mode using the SetRelayOutputSettings operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with SetRelayOutputSettings operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetRelayOutputSettings request message to set setting of relay output in "Bistable" mode.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetRelayOutputSettingsResponse message.

section.para: NOTE: If Client SetRelayOutputSettings request message does not contain "Bistable" value of "<Mode>" tag then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetRelayOutputSettings request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetRelayOutputSettings request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetRelayOutputSettings>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetRelayOutputSettings>" includes tag: "<RelayOutputToken>" with non-empty string value AND [S3] "<SetRelayOutputSettings>" includes tag: "<Properties>" AND [S4] "<Properties>" includes tag: "<Mode>" with "Bistable" value AND [S5] "<Properties>" includes tag: "<DelayTime>" AND [S6] "<Properties>" includes tag: "<IdleState>" with "Closed" OR "Open" value AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response contains "<SetRelayOutputSettingsResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: RelayOutputs_SetRelayOutputSettingsBistable

title.emphasis: SET RELAY OUTPUT SETTINGS MONOSTABLE MODE

section.para: Test Label: Relay Outputs - SetRelayOutputSettings Monostable Mode
Test Case ID: RELAYOUTPUTS-4
Affected Profiles: S - conditional
Feature Under Test: Relay Outputs
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to set settings of relay output in "Monostable" mode using the SetRelayOutputSettings operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with SetRelayOutputSettings operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetRelayOutputSettings request message to set setting of relay output in "Monostable" mode.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetRelayOutputSettingsResponse message.

section.para: NOTE: If Client SetRelayOutputSettings request message does not contain "Monostable" value of "<Mode>" tag then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetRelayOutputSettings request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetRelayOutputSettings request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetRelayOutputSettings>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetRelayOutputSettings>" includes tag: "<RelayOutputToken>" with non-empty string value AND [S3] "<SetRelayOutputSettings>" includes tag: "<Properties>" AND [S4] "<Properties>" includes tag: "<Mode>" with "Monostable" value AND [S5] "<Properties>" includes tag: "<DelayTime>" AND [S6] "<Properties>" includes tag: "<IdleState>" with "Closed" OR "Open" value AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response contains "<SetRelayOutputSettingsResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to configure synchronization of time using NTP servers on Device.

Client is considered as supporting NTP if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to get the NTP settings from Device using the GetNTP operation AND
Client is able to set the NTP settings on Device using the SetNTP operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting NTP if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetNTP request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetNTP request.

section.para: Test Label: NTP - GetNTP
Test Case ID: NTP-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional
Feature Under Test: NTP
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to get the NTP settings from Device using the GetNTP operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetNTP operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetNTP request message to get current settings of NTP servers on Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetNTPResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetNTP request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetNTP request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetNTP>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetNTPResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: NTP_GetNTP
Test Label: NTP - SetNTP
Test Case ID: NTP-2
Affected Profiles: S - conditional
Feature Under Test: NTP
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to set the NTP settings on Device using the SetNTP operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with SetNTP operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetNTP request message to set the NTP servers settings on Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetNTPResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetNTP request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetNTP request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetNTP>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetNTP>" includes tag: "<FromDHCP>" with "TRUE" OR "FALSE" value AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<SetNTPResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: NTP_SetNTP

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to configure Dynamic DNS settings.

Client is considered as supporting Dynamic DNS if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to get the Dynamic DNS settings from Device using the GetDynamicDNS operation AND
Client is able to set the Dynamic DNS settings on Device using the SetDynamicDNS operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Dynamic DNS if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetDynamicDNS request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetDynamicDNS request.

Affected Profiles: S - conditional
Feature Under Test: Dynamic DNS
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able get the dynamic DNS settings from Device using the GetDynamicDNS operation.

FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

Affected Profiles: S - conditional

Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetDynamicDNSResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetDynamicDNS request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetDynamicDNS request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetDynamicDNS>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetDynamicDNS>" includes tag: "<Type>" with value EITHER "NoUpdate" OR "ClientUpdates" OR "ServerUpdates" AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<SetDynamicDNSResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to manage IP address filters.

Client is considered as supporting IP Address Filtering if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to get the IP address filter settings from Device using the GetIPAddressFilter operation AND
Client is able to set the IP address filter settings on Device using the SetIPAddressFilter operation AND
Client is able to add the IP address filter settings to Device using the AddIPAddressFilter operation AND
Client is able to delete the IP address filter settings from Device using the RemoveIPAddressFilter operation.
NOTE: Requests SetIPAddressFilter, AddIPAddressFilter and RemoveIPAddressFilter are permitted to use the IPv4 OR IPv6 protocol settings.

Client is considered as NOT supporting IP Address Filtering if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetIPAddressFilter request OR
No Valid Device Response to SetIPAddressFilter request OR
No Valid Device Response to AddIPAddressFilter request OR
No Valid Device Response to RemoveIPAddressFilter request.
NOTE: Requests SetIPAddressFilter, AddIPAddressFilter and RemoveIPAddressFilter should be deemed as failed if both IPv4 AND IPv6 protocol settings have No Valid Device Responses.

section.para: Test Label: IP Address Filtering - GetIPAddressFilter
Test Case ID: IPADDRESSFILTERING-1
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: IP Address Filtering
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to get the IP address filter settings from Device using the GetIPAddressFilter operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetIPAddressFilter operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetIPAddressFilter request message to get the IP address filter settings from Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetIPAddressFilterResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetIPAddressFilter request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetIPAddressFilter request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetIPAddressFilter>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetIPAddressFilterResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: IPAddressFiltering_GetIPAddressFilter

Affected Profiles: S - conditional, C - conditional

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetIPAddressFilterResponse message.

section.para: NOTE: If Client SetIPAddressFilter request message does not contain "<IPv4Address>" tag then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetIPAddressFilter request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetIPAddressFilter request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetIPAddressFilter>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<Type>" with "Allow" OR "Deny" value AND [S3] "<SetIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<IPv4Address>" AND [S4] "<IPv4Address>" includes tag: "<Address>" with specific IPv4 address value AND [S5] "<IPv4Address>" includes tag: "<PrefixLength>" with value range from "0" to "32" AND [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S7] Device response contains "<SetIPAddressFilterResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetIPAddressFilterResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetIPAddressFilter request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetIPAddressFilter request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetIPAddressFilter>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<Type>" with "Allow" OR "Deny" value AND [S3] "<SetIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<IPv6Address>" AND [S4] "<IPv6Address>" includes tag: "<Address>" with specific IPv6 address value AND [S5] "<IPv6Address>" includes tag: "<PrefixLength>" with value range from "0" to "128" AND [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S7] Device response contains "<SetIPAddressFilterResponse>" tag.

FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: IPAddressFiltering_AddIPv4AddressFilter
Test Label: IP Address Filtering - AddIPv6AddressFilter
Test Case ID: IPADDRESSFILTERING-5
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: IP Address Filtering
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to add the IP address filter to Device using the AddIPAddressFilter operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with AddIPAddressFilter operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes AddIPAddressFilter request message to add the IP address filter on Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and AddIPAddressFilterResponse message.

section.para: NOTE: If Client AddIPAddressFilter request message does not contain "<IPv6Address>" tag then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client AddIPAddressFilter request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client AddIPAddressFilter request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<AddIPAddressFilter>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<AddIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<Type>" with "Allow" OR "Deny" value AND [S3] "<AddIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<IPv6Address>" AND [S4] "<IPv6Address>" includes tag: "<Address>" with specific IPv6 address value AND [S5] "<IPv6Address>" includes tag: "<PrefixLength>" with value range from "0" to "128" AND [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S7] Device response contains "<AddIPAddressFilterResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: IPAddressFiltering_AddIPv6AddressFilter
Test Label: IP Address Filtering - RemoveIPv4AddressFilter
Test Case ID: IPADDRESSFILTERING-6
Affected Profiles: S - conditional, C - conditional
Feature Under Test: IP Address Filtering
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to delete the IP address filter from Device using the RemoveIPAddressFilter operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with RemoveIPAddressFilter operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes RemoveIPAddressFilter request message to delete the IP address filter from Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and RemoveIPAddressFilterResponse message.

section.para: NOTE: If Client RemoveIPAddressFilter request message does not contain "<IPv4Address>" tag then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client RemoveIPAddressFilter request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client RemoveIPAddressFilter request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<RemoveIPAddressFilter>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<RemoveIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<Type>" with "Allow" OR "Deny" value AND [S3] "<RemoveIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<IPv4Address>" AND [S4] "<IPv4Address>" includes tag: "<Address>" with specific IPv4 address value AND [S5] "<IPv4Address>" includes tag: "<PrefixLength>" with value range from "0" to "32" AND [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S7] Device response contains "<RemoveIPAddressFilterResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

Feature Under Test: IP Address Filtering
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to delete the IP address filter from Device using the RemoveIPAddressFilter operation.

listitem.para: Client invokes RemoveIPAddressFilter request message to delete the IP address filter from Device.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and RemoveIPAddressFilterResponse message.

section.para: NOTE: If Client RemoveIPAddressFilter request message does not contain "<IPv6Address>" tag then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client RemoveIPAddressFilter request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client RemoveIPAddressFilter request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to devicemgmt.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<RemoveIPAddressFilter>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<RemoveIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<Type>" with "Allow" OR "Deny" value AND [S3] "<RemoveIPAddressFilter>" includes tag: "<IPv6Address>" AND [S4] "<IPv6Address>" includes tag: "<Address>" with specific IPv6 address value AND [S5] "<IPv6Address>" includes tag: "<PrefixLength>" with value range from "0" to "128" AND [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S7] Device response contains "<RemoveIPAddressFilterResponse>" tag.

section.title: Persistent Notification Storage Retrieval Test Cases

listitem.para: Client subscribes to device messages using CreatePullPointSubscription operation.
Client uses Seek method to change position of the pull pointer to include all NotificationMessages in the persistent storage with UtcTime attribute greater than or equal to the Seek argument.
Client uses Pull Point event mechanism to retrieve notification events from Device.

Client is considered as supporting Persistent Notification Storage Retrieval if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to seek stored events in Device using the Seek operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Persistent Notification Storage Retrieval if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to Seek request.

section.para: Test Label: Persistent Notification Storage Retrieval - Seek
Test Case ID: PERSISTENTNOTIFICATIONSTORAGERETRIEVAL-1
Affected Profiles: C - conditional
Feature Under Test: Persistent Notification Storage Retrieval
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to seek stored events in Device using Pull Point event mechanism and Seek operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with CreatePullPointSubscription, Seek and PullMessages operations present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes CreatePullPointSubscription message.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreatePullPointSubscriptionResponse message.
Client invokes Seek message to re-adjust the pull pointer into the past.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SeekResponse message.
Client invokes PullMessages command with Timeout and MessageLimit elements.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and PullMessagesResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client CreatePullPointSubscription request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client CreatePullPointSubscription request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to event.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<CreatePullPointSubscription>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<CreatePullPointSubscriptionResponse>" tag AND Client Seek request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client Seek request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to event.wsdl) AND [S4] Client request contains "<Seek>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S5] "<Seek>" includes tag: "<UtcTime>" with non-empty value of date and time AND [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S7] Device response contains "<SeekResponse>" tag AND Client PullMessages request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client PullMessages request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to event.wsdl) AND [S8] Client request contains "<PullMessages>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S9] "<PullMessages>" includes tag: "<Timeout>" AND [S10] "<PullMessages>" includes tag: "<MessageLimit>" AND [S11] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S12] Device response contains "<PullMessagesResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.
section.para: Validated Feature List: PersistentNotificationStorageRetrieval_Seek

listitem.para: Pass criteria in EVENTHANDLING-3 test case has been updated (added check for URI in RTSP SETUP request).
No major changes were made, just minor formatting fixes.
No major changes were made, just minor grammatical corrections.
